body.p:
Clinton Ky 23, April 1861
Gov. B. Magoffin
Dear Gov'r

At the November Term 1860 of the Equity & Criminal Court for Hickman County two Separate Judgments in favor of the Commonwealth upon Indictments were rendered against John M Johnson for Gaming for the Sum of $20 in each case -- The gaming consisted in pitching dollars on two occasion for ten cents -- Although the statute is broad and embraces every species of hazzard at which money is bet & lost. yet I dont believes its spirit intended to embrace such innocent sport as that. Mr Johnson is a highly respectable young man and not at all addicted to gambling in any shape. and during that Summer our best citizens occasionally engaged in that amusement upon what is called, a thousand board It is certainly a proper case for the interposition of your Excellency -- I hope you will forward me a remit for these two Judgments forthwith & oblige your friend

Hickman Equity Ct
2 Judgts
$20 } Gaming
Jno. M Johnson
Issd Apr 30. 1861
